reviews.sentence: Excellent location nice rooms good gym and pool. Stayed here twice within the space of a week and both stays were good. The location could not be better next to Market Street and Powell station for the BART convenient for airport transfers. The hotel lobby does feel like a conference venue which it is but it has friendly staff and is spacious. The rooms were a good size and had everything we needed including plenty of electrical sockets robes and an iron. The beds are very comfortable and we had rooms on floor 17 and 18 which were nice for views. The gym and pool are both well equipped much better than many hotels I have stayed at. Overall I had recommend this hotel for anyone visiting San Francisco whether for business or sightseeing.

Excellent location nice rooms good gym and pool. Stayed here twice within the space of a week and both stays were good. The location could not be better next to Market Street and Powell station for the BART convenient for airport transfers. The hotel lobby does feel like a conference venue which it is but it has friendly staff and is spacious. The rooms were a good size and had everything we needed including plenty of electrical sockets robes and an iron. The beds are very comfortable and we had rooms on floor 17 and 18 which were nice for views. The gym and pool are both well equipped much better than many hotels I have stayed at. Overall I had recommend this hotel for anyone visiting San Francisco whether for business or sightseeing.
I love this hotel. Super friendly staff. Super comfortable clean rooms. Great workout room and pool and hot tub. Everything. Nothing. it is perfect.

Consistent quality. Typical Mariot. It is conveniently located near Moscone Center so they get a lot of folks for trade shows and conferences. I usually stay there when in town on business. Great staff treats you as if you were most important guest which is nice. Energetic hotel bar. They have a nice fitness center and swimming pool for those who like to get a good start to the day with a few laps. Cabs always lined up for transportation. Clean rooms updated bathrooms. Wake up calls are done promptly which is very important to me. I have stayed in many hotels that drop the ball on this. Highly recommend.

excellent. We arrived dead tired after a 3 day long train ride from New York and we were welcomed at the reception so kind and helpful that we felt relieved The receptionist gave us an upgrade so we got a very large room with big windows a very large bathroom and in general we had everything we needed. Also very comfy beds and very quiet. Breakfast was excellent service great for sure a hotel to go back to. There is a wunderful inside pool a spa with all kind of massages and treatments and the situation of the hotel is very good close to shops restaurants and the citys center.

Great location good comfort. The hotel is a typical conference hotel as it is big and unpersonal but on the other hand it means that they have good quality when it comes to staff and services. The bar located at 39th floor is a must to visit with great view of the city. The hotel has also a well equipped gym and a pool and hot bubble bath. Breakfast not included but plenty of cheaper options just around the corner Boudin La Bolangerie or american diners. Perfect location close to Powell Street and Union Square.

Impressed. I have spent lots of time in SF but this was my first stay at the Mariot Marquis. Like many others I was there for a business conference and I have to say that it is set up pretty well to serve the conference circuitI am a rewards member with not many points so not sure if that affected my experience or not but here is what I found. Check in was easy and I was able to get the room by 1230Excelent service from the bell staff front desk and concierge. Friendly and helpful. The room was quite large by SF standards with a wet bar with fridge and coffee maker and large sitting area with couches and tables. The windows opened to let the breeze in it was sunny and warm this trip. Housekeeping was on point friendly and efficient. The only down side of the room was theTV. High def TV playing analog signal and the image was substandard. No street noiseWiFi was free maybe due to my membership and had enough bandwidth to support Netflix streaming. On the first day I recevied an email from management welcoming me and requesting that I relay any requests or concerns. This was useful as I wound up having one issue which was addressed quickly and professionally very good customer serviceWe enjoyed the indoor pool and hot tub as well as the upsairs lounge with great views of the bridge and bay. Reasonable drink prices here. As mentioned it is ridiculously expensive to park here but that is everywhere in the city. Location is great and you do not need a car in SFI would return without a doubt. The room was so much larger than any I have had in the city the staff was so pleasant and the location optimal.

huge facility too many people. in the midst of a very busy area always concious that many people surround you. Area not very pleasing with so many street people around Construction everywhere making connections difficult. Though San Franciscans very generous when asked for help. the pools were a great distraction easy to get around on buses and trolleys.

Convenient Location Helpful Staff. I stayed at this hotel for a conference held at Moscone Center and at various hotels around downtown San Francisco and found the Mariot Marquis to be a very convenient location. The hotel staff was very professional and helpful especially those at the Concierge Desk and the Bell Station. Actually the whole lobby was well staffed for people like me with lots of questions especially re directions. The in house eating options were a little bit hit or miss though. My favorites were the Happy Hour at The View Lounge on the top floor great view and the breakfast buffet in the Mission Grille lots of options. I also enjoyed the pool and hot tub. My room was well cleaned each day.
Nice hotel good location. No pool makes Alan a sad boy.

Our stay was OK. Tvs did not work and the website hotel signs and tablets in the rooms advertised a swimming pool which does not actually exist. Staff was kind and helpful though when we were looking for places to eat and when we were trying to figure out public transportation.

Ok hotel and no pool. The pool was one of the reason to choose this hotel since we have small kids but suprisely there is no pool anymore apparently since august. Average hotel super busy no room service and good location. Super expensive valet 77 usd per day. The rooms need some upgrade.

Everything but a pool. We can always rely on Mariot for a very pleasant hotel experience. We spend a few days at this hotel for a conference that also took place at the hotel and enjoyed it. The elevator was fast. I was especially pleased with the mobile check in process as I was able to check in much faster than about 5 or 6 other people who were waiting in line. My wife and I took our 9year old with us and his only complaint was that the hotel did not have a swimming pool.
Loved the foyer. Our favourite part was the rooftop lounge with the spectacular view. DownsideShower vent was so dusty and we are used to a pool but it ’s not very common in SF.

One of my favorite Mariots Awesome Service and Location. I am long term Mariot Client 80 nights worldwide. Great location to get to everything yet a quite enough area that you do not feel overwhelmed. Yes the hotel is under construction but I did not find any real issues. We were out during the day. The new lobby is very nice. Dan at the Concierge Desk is one of the best I have experienced. He can validate any plans and provide guidance. They also have a good website with info. The lounge was top notch and one of the best in terms of seating quality of food and service. The View Lounge is awesome but is small and expensive. You need to go up and at least have a drink and relax. Someone mentioned not enough pillows we just called down and they brought pillows in a few minutes. The internet was decent no issues. We loved that they kept the windows that open. Love getting fresh air in a room. The gym is the best one I have seen in a Mariot outside of the Renaissance Spots. It is two floors and great selection of weights machines and cardio machines. They have steam room and small spa. did not try the pool as it was cold but it looked nice.

It was kind of a let down. I expected much more for the location and price. In the in room dining was brought to the bell desk even though it says they will knock on your door even if your do not disturb sign is on the handle. And the food was horrible. ……. ……. We had the King Suite. Oh and parking is 80 100 bucks a nightA pool and hot tub would have been nice. You kind of feel like your in a small box when you enter the hotel. Very cut up to be fair though there was a whole section closed off that said it was under construction. I did over hear another guest complain about a party next to their room that was still going on at 6 am the front desk person just laughed and said it is St Patricks day.

No pool no room service but ypu can order from places and have charged to your room. However the delivery fee is 10Thats my onlt complaint though. Super nice staff is super helpful. And target is right next door.

Overly priced hotel. No internet facilities in the room. You have to pay 14 dollars per day to use the WiFi. We end up staying in the lobby to download maps and photos. Very busy and noisy lobby. We have our own mobile date which somehow wo n’t work in the room but only in the lobby. It was quiet frustrating considering the amount ur paying per night for the room. There was also no pool or gym facilities.

Mariot Marquis SF. Could have used better lighting. Staff knowledgeable and helpful. Elevators rapid and efficient. Why is a pool mentioned on hotel website when none exists. Why should there be a 200 word minimum. Do you expect your clients to be verbose prolix loquacious rather than terse succinct to the point and articulate.
